description: cycle number
center latitude based on selected segments
center longitude based on selected segments
the reference point number, m, counted from the equator crossing of the RGT
mean GPS time for the segments for each pass
the mean corrected height
the formal error in the corrected height
the magnitude of all errors that might be correlated at scales larger than a single fit center (e.g. pointing errors, GPS errors, etc)
Summary flag: zero indicates high-quality cycles: where min_signal_selection_source <=1 and min_SNR_significance < 0.02, and ATL06_summary_zero_count >0.
0 indicates that normal fitting was attempted, 1 indicates that the signal selection algorithm rejected too many repeats, and only a linear fit was attempted
the RMS of the slope of the fit polynomial within 50 m of the fit center
the mean East-component slope for the reference surface within 50 m of the fit center
the mean North-component slope for the reference surface within 50 m of the fit center
Mean along-track component of the slope of the reference surface within 50 m of the fit center
Mean cross-track component of the slope of the reference surface within 50 m of the fit center
Maximum degree of non-zero polynomial components in x
Maximum degree of non-zero polynomial components in y
polynomial coefficients (up to degree 3), for polynomial components scaled by 100 m
formal errors for the polynomial coefficients
Ref point number, counted from the equator crossing along the RGT.
Along-track coordinate of the reference point, measured along the RGT from its first equator crossing.
Across-track coordinate of the reference point, measured along the RGT from its first equator crossing.
Reference track azimuth, in degrees east of local north
rate of change of the x component of the surface slope
rate of change of the y component of the  surface slope
Formal error in the rate of change of the x component of the surface slope
Formal error in the rate of change of the y component of the surface slope
misfit chi square, divided by the number of degrees in the solution
RMS misfit for the surface-polynomial fit

Indicates quality of the fit: 0: no problem identified, 1: number cycles available less than 1, 2: no valid pairs after height error check, 3: no valid pairs after slope editing, 4: only one valid pair in x direction, 5: polynomial fit failed, 6: polynomial coefficients with high errors, 7: surface fit slope high, 8: all cycles have errors > 15 mRMS
cycle number
Number of segments with ATL06_quality_summary==0 (0 indicates the best-quality data)
Weighted-average RMS misfit between PE heights and along-track land-ice segment fit
Weighted-average effective, uncorrected reflectance for each pass.
Weighted-average ocean tide for each pass
Minimum cloud flag from ATL06: Flag indicates confidence that clouds with OT > 0.2 are present in the lower 3 km of the atmosphere based on ATL09
Minimum apparent-surface-reflectance -based cloud flag from ATL06: Flag indicates confidence that clouds with OT > 0.2 are present in the lower 3 km of the atmosphere based on ATL09
Weighted-average  blowing snow layer height for each cycle
Maximum bsnow_conf flag from ATL06: indicates the greatest (among segments) confidence flag for presence of blowing snow for each cycle
weighted average of pair-center RGT y coordinates for each cycle
weighted mean of pair-center RGT y coordinates for each cycle
Ref point number, counted from the equator crossing along the RGT.
Number of segments marked as valid for each cycle.  Equal to 0 for those cycles not included in the reference-surface shape fit.
Minimum of the ATL06 signal_selection_source value (indicates the highest-quality segment in the cycle)
Minimum of SNR_significance (indicates the quality of the best segment in the cycle)
Root-mean-weighted-square-average total vertical geolocation error due to PPD and POD
Root-mean-weighted-square-average Êlocal-coordinate x horizontal geolocation error for each cycle due to PPD and POD
Root-mean-weighted-square-average Êlocal-coordinate y horizontal geolocation error for each cycle due to PPD and POD
Weighted-average of surface heights, not including the correction for the reference surface
The reference-point number of the fit center for the datum track
Time relative to the ICESat-2 reference epoch
WGS-84 height, corrected for the ATL11 surface shape
Error in the height estimate
Error in the height estimate
latitude of the crossover point
longitude of the crossover point
Cycle number for the crossing data
The RGT number for the crossing data
The spot number for the crossing data
Quality flag for the crossing data derived from ATL06.  0 indicates no problems detected, 1 indicates potential problems
Root sum of the squared differences between the heights of the endpoints for the current segment and the centers of the previous and next segments
